name: CSSRule
description: The CSSRule interface represents a single CSS rule. There are several types of rules, listed in the Type constants section below.

members.name: CSSRule.cssText
members.description: Represents the textual representation of the rule, e.g. "h1,h2 { font-size: 16pt }" or "@import 'url'". To access or modify parts of the rule (e.g. the value of "font-size" in the example) use the properties on theÂ specialized interface for the rule's type.

members.name: CSSRule.parentRule
members.description: Returns the containing rule, otherwise null. E.g. if this rule is a style rule inside an @media block, the parent rule would be that CSSMediaRule.

members.name: CSSRule.parentStyleSheet
members.description: Returns the CSSStyleSheet object for the style sheet that contains this rule

members.name: CSSRule.type
members.description: One of the Type constants indicating the type of CSS rule.
